review_title: Getting so bad had to leave.
pros: Very few… Great coworkers. Nice having phlebotomy and IV team (hope this stays). Learned a lot
cons: Horrible. Your license is at risk. Hospital is going through mass exoduses on most floors. CEO increased RN to patient ratio- VERY UNSAFE. CEO also got rid of incentive pay for picking up extra shifts. Inappropriate bed assignments. Covid pandemic did play a part in losing some staff but administration is doing NOTHING to keep their current staff. Start of the pandemic was nearly 3 years ago and the mass exodus is just starting- seems like management can’t blame this one on COVID. Benefits are not up to par considering this is a healthcare facility. Insurance company used is a joke.

pros: benefits and pay were ok. new facility was very nice. new equipment and machines are very nice. new floor plan and the flow of department was good.
cons: Management does not listen to everyone equally. They also don't listen to experienced suggestions for things that would make things run smoother. They play favorites and don't teach new employees very well. Manager also does not know how to do the things he asks his employees to do. (Ex. run sterilizers, assemble trays and wrap.) and Human Resources sides with Management when it comes to problems in the department, even when they see it for themselves and are told the same issues by numerous techs.

job_title: Registered Nurse in East Chicago, IN
pros: Insurance and PTO Benefits, some flexibility in scheduling as in "self-scheduling", pay is good.  Strict attendance policy. corrective action policy good but only works when enforced.
cons: Difficulty transferring to new departments/units for HR recruiter is lax in sending job transfers through so new managers never receive them.  Lazy co-coworker's, low standards of employees, virtually no teamwork, workers lack compassion for patients, no efforts towards retaining staff, high turnover of staff nurses and CNAs/PCTs, difficult to advance r/t politics.  Many staff are on cell phones or ipads.

job_title: Follow Up Team/Customer Service Representative in Saint John, IN
pros: Nice office building to work in, people are nice, and it was close to home.
cons: Managers and team leads were to clicky, felt like you were walking into high school all over again. Also the team leads and most supervisors really didn't kniwnhownto manage their departments.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cedar Lake, IN
pros: Great company to work for , room for growth if you are committed depending on what department you work for. Benefits are great!
cons: Patient accounting including registration department have power trips and operate separately from the rest of the system. I've been within and without the department of pfs and for some reason that department has its own rules apart from the rest of the system. My mistake was transferring into pfs, I should have stayed where I was at. They want to control everything and intelligence is not a pro in this department, if you are smart management is threatened by it. Once you see half the management team you wonder how they got their job, 1/2 of them are not knowledgeable but are expected to lead a department, the director is happy with having them as her puppets and will hire you if you are intimidated by her. Your attire and vacation rules are separate from the rest of the system if you are with pfs. I did learn a lot on my own but had to leave as I could not go to my superiors for anything and could no longer handle all the bs rules the director placed on everyone who I assume since she signed every policy sent out. One silly rule is if you have less then 40 hours pto you are not allowed to request any time off. Ha, that is my time earned do not tell me I cannot use it. This is an example of how petty the department can be yet are not concerned that registrars cannot do something as simple as verify an insurance.

pros:
Some of the people I worked were really good and were team-oriented. The afternoon shift would get you out of work by 8:30.
Community hospital is a great place to work.
cons: Very little flexibility in all aspects. Management treats everyone as if they are disposable, techs, aides, etc. I worked in three different departments at this hospital, and this one was by far the worst. It was such a disappointment after having great experiences in other departments.

review_title: Great place, lack of updating to current times
job_title: Physical Therapist Assistant in Munster, IN
pros: Great hours 8-4:30, benefits are great, plenty of vacation time, very few weekends and only 2 holidays yearly. Overall great co-workers, and good exposure to learning different diagnoses with 2 month rotations through the floor units.
cons: Expect high caseloads on both PTAs (15-18) and PTs (10-14). Poor communication with supervisory staff. Lack of ethical mindset with charges for certain staff. Unreal expectations at times.

review_title: Good hospital, great employees, managers suck

cons: Very poor raises; Management screws employees over quite often; penalized with point system for sick days; work conditions not always ideal; some departments better than others; high turnover in certain departments; poor employee morale'; management not to be trusted; xpensive cafeteria food;

job_title: Registered Nurse in Crown Point, IN
pros: Great co-workers. The system has a good vision and provides the tools necessary to complete your job. Community is very busy so job security is good.
cons: Although most co-workers are great, some can be simply lazy and it doesn't get recognized. Pay for staff RNs is a little low and the same across all scopes/depts. There is no differentials for intensive care, cath lab or surgical type nursing...

review_title: Not as great as they thing they are
pros: Well known name    Good people work there
cons: Mgt of some depts is very poor    Pay is poor and no incentive to make more since raises are per a scale and have nothing to do with ability

pros: They hire Nurse Fellows at a .1 FTE which was every other weekend and holiday and really flexible around school. The pay is also better than the CNAs depending on which hospital you pick. The NFs started at $14/hr.
cons: The floor I was on was pretty aggressive about taking time off that wasn't scheduled. Easy to fix with swapping hours with someone. No insurance offered for NFs.

review_title: Not all its cracked up to be.  There are better jobs out there
pros: Met some good people along the way, made some good connections...
cons:
There is no attempt whatsoever to invest in employees.  I worked there for 10 years and was sent to training 2 times.  Management does not care at all.  PERIOD.  I unwillingly "took" a promotion where I was given twice the responsibility with no raise in pay.  Management rewards high performers with more work and rude treatment instead of a raise in pay or a compliment.  The insolent employees are not reprimanded; they are ignored and left to continue being useless.  This places a greater burden on the high performer (this has gone on for years).  Employees are lied to on a daily basis.  Many managers act unreasonable. I met people from every single department in all 3 hospitals that were completely miserable because of the job.

Employees are not treated with respect at all.  There is a lot of "in fighting" between departments as well as different sects of departments.  The upper crust management really treats the rest of staff like garbage. I used to have to attend the "management rah rah rally meetings" and its pretty cut-throat.  There is constant, high rate of turn over..management knows this and doesn't care.  HR is only there to protect the interests of the organization.  When people leave or are fired, there is no sense of urgency in rehiring.  Instead they place the extra work on the rest of the "team" to see if it can be handled or not.  It usually takes anywhere from 4-9 months to rehire.  Some departments were great with patient care..some other departments not so much.  Anyone that works or has worked there can attest to all of this.  This job made me hate myself at times because I continually put up with it.  I feel much better now that I'm gone from this miserable place.

review_title: Working at St. Mary's has been a great experience.  My co workers and manager are awesome individuals
pros: Nurses have a voice and we make a difference as part of shared governance.  It's a friendly culture centered around patient care and team work
cons: Some of the doctors are rude to nurses for no reason, but I think that's anywhere you go
